intro: Corydalis remota f. nonapiculata, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while the stems are slender and branching. This variety is distinguished by its reduced or absent floral bracts, giving it a unique appearance compared to other members of the species.
